title.narrative: Emergency WASH Response to IDPs and host community affected by drought in Sitti zone

description.narrative:
The El Nino event of 2015 is characterized by strange rainfall patterns, which lead to minimal rainfall in some parts of the country while flooding others with extraordinary amount of rain. In the Siti zone of the Somali region the El Nino exacerbated a protracted drought and led to the failure of three seasons’ rain which has caused internal human and livestock migrations, massive displacement, loss of livestock and livelihoods and tremendous suffering. In particular, the El Nino event and resultant drought has led to severe water shortage forcing humans to receive far less than recommended amount of water per person per day. NRC therefore developed this project to mitigate the immediate and long term effects of this drought through WASH and concomitant sanitation and hygiene interventions in Erer, Hadhagala and Afdem woredas of Siti zone. The project will comprise of:
1. Drilling of a new borehole complete with electro mechanical (generator, pump etc.) set and on-spot construction including (2) water points, (2) animal troughs and (2) elevated tanks. The site of the new borehole will be consulted with local authority and partners as some progress is made between assessment and now. 2. On-spot for an existing borehole drilled by Oromia water works in Asbuli, Erer which was capped upon completion and never utilized. The data and history of this borehole is at hand which will make it easier for action and completion. This activity will include (2) water points, (2) animal troughs and (2) elevated water tanks. 3. Construction of five (5) new hand-dug wells in Erer, Afdem and Hadhagala woredas 4. Moreover, NRC will construct (30) emergency communal latrines in the three woredas especially in IDP settlements. 5. Establishment/expansion of ten (10) institutional sanitation facilities with hand-wash basins in the affected areas 6. Establishment and training of (11) WASH committees and 7. Conducting 10 mass sanitation and hygiene campaigns
In this intervention, NRC will generally target the drought affected community in Sitti zones. The target groups include IDP households and host communities, and special focus will be on women and children. NRC will work with zonal administration, regional water bureau (RWB), UNICEF and other partners to develop selection criteria to determine both areas of intervention and the most vulnerable among the target population. 48,000 (8,000 HHs) individuals are targeted to benefit from this intervention.
The proposal is a continuation of WASH activities that NRC is currently implementing in Siti zone and will complement it to cover more unreached IDPs and host community affected by the drought. NRC will build on experiences garnered from Dolo Ado refugee camp WASH intervention and recently completed WASH project in Fafan zone to ensure smooth delivery of a high quality intervention for the drought affected populations in Siti.
